definition[0]: a feeling that you like or love someone or something and that you would be unhappy without them
example[0]: a child’s attachment to its mother
definition[1]: a part that you can put onto a machine to make it do a particular job
example[1]: The vacuum cleaner has various attachments.
definition[2]: belief in and loyalty towards a particular idea, organization etc
example[2]: old people’s attachment to traditional customs
definition[3]: a document or file that is sent with an email message
example[3]: I’ll send the spreadsheet as an attachment.
definition[4]: when you fasten or connect one thing to another, or the thing that you use to do this
example[4]: Hooks were fixed to the wall for the attachment of the ropes.
example[5]: the attachments that secure your boots firmly to the skis
definition[5]: a situation in which part of the money someone earns or money that is owed to them is taken by a court of law and used to pay their debts
definition[6]: a piece of paper fastened to a document such as an insurance agreement, which shows a special condition of the agreement
definition[7]: when part of someone’s earnings or money that is owed to them is taken by a court and used to pay their debts
example[6]: Organizations can apply to have an attachment of earnings made on someone who owes them money.
definition[8]: a document which is sent as part of an EMAIL message
example[7]: You can send me the spreadsheet as an attachment.
